result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Burns

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael Anthony Burns in court.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Michael Anthony Burns.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22TR2263; 22TR2322-Refusal Br. 1)Counsel's first appearance. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and awaiting blood results.

Motion for Discovery and Inspection & Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Amount: $20.00
22R 017366 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #17272 on 9-12-22
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No entry to any business where primary business is sale or service of alcohol.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael Anthony Burns appeared by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  State requests $3,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant states has ability to post some cash bond.  Court orders $2,500.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
